slideInfo.qText: What is King James’ point of view as expressed in <font size='18'><font face='c-Italic'>The True Lawe of Free Monarchies?</font></font> Is this source reliable? Explain why or why not.
slideInfo.correctText:
King James’ point of view is that kings are given their power by God and all should obey them. He probably thinks this way because he is a king and has been brought up to believe that God has chosen him to rule from birth. He was influenced by his position (being born heir to a throne).
The book may not be an entirely reliable source, since it does not necessarily represent the views of a majority of his subjects. Historians could use it to determine how monarchs justified their authority and felt about their position as ruler during this period.
